title: Spain
excerpt: A country on the Iberian Peninsula with Mediterranean culture
text: Spain is a country on the Iberian Peninsula in Southern Europe known for its Mediterranean culture, art, and architecture. Madrid, the capital, is known for its museums, galleries, and vibrant nightlife. Spain has a population of about 47 million and is famous for its art (Gaud√≠, Picasso), flamenco dance, and cuisine. The Sagrada Familia in Barcelona is one of the most iconic buildings in the world. Spain joined the European Union in 1986 and adopted the Euro in 2002. The country is known for its regional diversity with distinct cultures in Catalonia, Basque Country, and Andalusia. Spain is famous for its beaches, bullfighting, and siesta tradition.
